As Father Barry,
who regularly con¬
ducts this column,
has been quite sick
these last few
months, I am taking
over for him this
time. The response
to our St. Margaret
Mary Novena was
exceptionally good
on the part of our
readers, listeners,
the press and radio
stations. In thus
promoting devotion
to St. Margaret Mary, I am sure we
helped increase devotion immensely to
the Sacred Heart of Jesus. Your financial
support was excellent and, in a practical
way, showed a deep concern for the
problem that confronts us with the ad¬
vent of Sacred Heart-TV. Thefe were
two sponsors who donated $100.00 each
and several fifty and twenty-five dollar
donations. Others for the most part do¬
nated one dollar or more, with a generous
number of five and ten dollar offerings.
With TV alone costing this office $300.00
a week, you can see why we appreciate
your Auxiliary and Sustaining member¬
ships and your novena offerings.
Thank you kindly—A Happy Christ¬
mas!
Father Joseph Connolly, S.J.,
Associate Director.

ST. MARGARET MARY TV. CLUB
Mrs. Antoinette Eno Del Vecchio Organizes
Thrifty Club to Promote Sacred Heart-TV.
Tonie
Mrs. Antoinette Eno Del Vecchio (Tonie) our tireless Sacred
Heart promoter, is determined that Sacred Heart TV must not fall
by the wayside because of lack of funds. To this end, she has set
up two boards in her club under the title of, St. Margaret Mary TV-
Club. Each board is measured to the means of donors. The first
Tonie has entitled “The Thrifty Club” whose members make a life¬
time membership donation of $50.00. Already four have signed up
for this club: Mr. John Heffernan, President of Gold Medal Beauty
Supply Company, Boston; Miss Rita Flaherty, private secretary to
Dr. W. Brickley; Mrs. Marguerite McDermott, Bell Telephone
supervisor; Mrs. Mae Stevens, housewife.
The second Club Tonie has entitled “The Monthly Club.” These
join as auxiliary members and donate monthly $1.00, $2.00 or $5.00
according to their means.
To date the totals for both clubs amount to $275.25.
Photo—Jim Phelan

A MUST
Rev. and dear Father Hale:
Mrs. Walsh and I enclose our humble
contribution ($25.00) to support of the
Sacred Heart Program which we listen
to through Station WNEB in this city on
Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and
sometimes on Friday nights at 8:15. Also
there is a program on Station WORC on
Sunday night at 9:15.
These broadcasts are the source of
much happiness and profit to Mrs. Walsh
and me. We allow no other program to
interfere qX the time the Sacred Heart
Program is on the air.
Henry C. Walsh, Worcester, Mass.
FROM ARCTIC CIRCLE!
Dear Father:
Thank you for your Sacred Heart
records which arrived safely. The used
ones were mailed back. We are grateful
for the inspiration the program provided
throughout the past year.
We enclose a check for $50 from the
Catholic men at Sondrestrom, a modest
donation, but this is a very small base.
We are sending some publicity which
you may care to use, pictures and a story
about the Sacred Heart Program at Son¬
drestrom, Greenland.
Sincerely,
(Rev.) Thomas A. McDonald
Chaplain (1st Lt.) USAF
Catholic Chaplain
A DOCTOR'S TRIBUTE
Gentlemen:
I have been practising medicine for
some thirty-five years. More and more I
find that in my medical work I have to
play the part of a priest. Many patients
that I see suffer from mental and emo¬
tional ailments and need spiritual guid¬
ance. Many of the talks that I have lis¬
tened to on The Sacred Heart Program
have been a great help to me in this
work. I am particularly anxious to get
the talks, including the following series:
“I was Sick and You Visited Me.” The
Series of talks on “Happy Family Liv¬
ing” and the Series of talks on “The Ser¬
mon On the Mount” that were given
some two months ago.
Enclosed, please find small contribu¬
tion.
Dr. .......
